arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca responds after Chelsea owners march into dressing room following Brighton defeat
arts.sum: Chelsea were beaten by Brighton at Stamford Bridge with Danny Welbeck scoring a brace and Maxim De Cuyper finding the net for the Seagulls, before Enzo Maresca faced uncomfortable questions

arts.ttl: Four things we learned from Chelsea 1-3 Brighton
arts.sum: Maresca referred to this as a 'present' in his post match press conference -his side had restricted their opponents to an xG of just 0.1 in the first half, but one mistake turned the game in their favour as they scored two goals in injury time to seal the win. The Blues dominated the first half and went into half time a goal ahead, but things collapsed after a sending off for defender Trevoh Chalobah, giving the Seagulls a man advantage.

arts.ttl: Chelsea 1-3 Brighton VERDICT: Why Enzo Maresca deserves criticism, the star who could be the Seagulls' next BIG sale - and the Blues player who you can't help but feel for
arts.sum: KIERAN GILL AT STAMFORD BRIDGE: Chelsea suffered a damaging 3-1 defeat by Brighton on Saturday to continue their indifferent start to the season.

arts.sum: Chelsea were leading through Enzo Fernandezâ€™s first-half header when Trevoh Chalobah was dismissed for a poor tackle.

arts.ttl: What Chelsea owner did after loss against Brighton with dressing room claim confirmed
Chelsea gave presents to Brighton and Man Utd - Maresca
arts.sum: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says his side gave away "presents" against in their 3-1 defeat to Brighton in addition to last week's defeat to Manchester United, as his side went down to 10 men after "mistakes" in both games.

arts.ttl: Chelsea: Enzo Maresca reveals clear message to players after Blues give Brighton 'presents' in defeat
arts.sum: West Londoners were reduced to ten men at Stamford Bridge

arts.ttl: Chelsea crisis worsens in Welbeck masterclass as Brighton take down 10-man Blues
arts.sum: Chelsea's defensive crisis worsens as Danny Welbeck steals the show in a 3-1 comeback win for Brighton & Hove Albion at Stamford Bridge.

arts.ttl: Maxim De Cuyper and Danny Welbeck pounce late as Brighton punish 10-man Chelsea
arts.sum: The rumblings of discontent at Chelsea grow louder. The frustration from the Stamford Bridge crowd was audible as they watched their team lose at home in the Premier League for the first time since last December. Enzo Marescaâ€™s substitutions came under the spotlight again and Chelsea, who are facing a defensive crisis before hosting Liverpool next weekend, were in a giving mood during this 3-1 defeat to Brighton. It was sweet for Brighton, given how many players and executives have swapped the south coast for west London during the past three years. The celebrations were wild when Danny Welbeckâ€™s second goal of the afternoon wrapped up the points deep into added time. Continue reading...
